sn11.17:4.2: Now at that time the Buddha had retreated to solitude for the day’s meditation.
sn11.17:4.3: Then Sakka, Lord of Gods, and Brahmā Sahampati approached the Buddha
sn11.17:4.4: and stationed themselves one by each door-post.
sn11.17:4.5: Then Sakka recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn11.17:5.1: “Rise, hero! Victor in battle, with burden put down,
sn11.17:5.4: like the moon on the fifteenth night.”
sn11.17:6.1: “Lord of Gods, that’s not how to pay homage to the Realized Ones.
sn11.17:6.2: This is how it should be done.”
sn11.17:7.1: “Rise, hero! Victor in battle, leader of the caravan,
sn11.17:7.3: Let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma!
sn11.17:7.4: There will be those who understand!”
